results.title: Choice of antihypertensive agent in isolated systolic hypertension and isolated diastolic hypertension: A secondary analysis of the ALLHAT trial.
results.text_hl: We compared the use of @CHEMICAL_Chlorthalidone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002752 @@@chlorthalidone@@@, @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@, or @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ on the primary outcome of combined @DISEASE_Coronary_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D003327 @@@coronary heart disease@@@, @DISEASE_Stroke @DISEASE_MESH:D020521 @@@stroke@@@, or all-cause mortality in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with isolated @DISEASE_Isolated_Systolic_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D000092244 @@@systolic hypertension@@@ or isolated @<m>DISEASE_Hypertension_Diastolic_Resistance_to</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C563897 @@@diastolic hypertension@@@.

citations.NLM: Wang SY, Hanna JM, Gongal P, Onuma OK, Nanna MG. Choice of antihypertensive agent in isolated systolic hypertension and isolated diastolic hypertension: A secondary analysis of the ALLHAT trial. Am Heart J. 2022 Dec;254():30-34. PMID: 35932912

results.title: Two-year follow-up study to evaluate the reduction of left ventricular mass and diastolic function in mild to moderate diastolic hypertensive patients.
results.text_hl: OBJECTIVE: To compare the effects of two antihypertensive agents, @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@, on left @DISEASE_Ventricular_Fibrillation @DISEASE_MESH:D014693 @@@ventricular@@@ mass and diastolic filling in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ from primary care centers with mild to moderate @<m>DISEASE_Hypertension_Diastolic_Resistance_to</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C563897 @@@diastolic hypertension@@@.

results.title: Lisinopril therapy for hemodialysis hypertension: hemodynamic and endocrine responses.

results.title: Blood pressure effects of combined beta-blocker and angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor therapy compared with the individual agents: a placebo-controlled study with nebivolol and lisinopril.
results.text_hl: The authors tested the additivity of the beta-blocker @CHEMICAL_Nebivolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068577 @@@nebivolol@@@, which has vasodilating activity, with the angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with stage 2 @<m>DISEASE_Hypertension_Diastolic_Resistance_to</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C563897 @@@diastolic hypertension@@@.

citations.NLM: Weber MA, Basile J, Stapff M, Khan B, Zhou D. J Clin Hypertens (Greenwich). 2012 Sep;14(9):588-92. PMID: 22947356
